column4: can anybody tell me why my fat32 partition that I just mounted isn't working properly?
uhhh
Just explained it to gen. :) What problems are you having?
sudo nautilus
Did it work?
Did Nautilus come up?
Hold on one second, let me help gen out.
Once you sudo nautilus, go the folder where your stuff was mounted
Yeah. Go to the folder where it was mounted.
What command did you type in to mount the drive?
Is the filesystem for your partition FAT32?
Go to the terminal and type in sudo gedit
Open up this file /etc/fstab.conf
Why?
Add this entry towards the top of your fstab, after proc            /proc           proc    defaults        0       0
/dev/hda2       /home/qmaster/windows   vfat    user,rw,umask=000,dmask=000,fmask=000        0        0
lol
Then, edit /dev/hda2 to /dev/hda5
Go in to your directory (/home/yourusername) and make a folder called windows there.
Then, change the /home/qmaster/windows to /home/YOURUSERNAMEHERE/windows
Got it all done? Save it and reboot.
Did it work?
Oh, never mind
PM me and I'll name you the apps. I use.
